summary: Email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorneys and attorney Jeff Jocks regarding a subpoena to Interlochen Center for Arts for records of tuition payments by Jeffrey Epstein or his entities. The response indicates Interlochen only keeps tuition records for 7 years and found no payments by Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey L. Jocks
persons.role: Attorney representing Interlochen Center for the Arts
persons.context: Attorney from Sondee, Racine & Doren, PLC who responds to the U.S. Attorney's Office subpoena regarding Epstein's potential tuition payments to Interlochen.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York who sends the subpoena to Interlochen Center for the Arts regarding Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: George B. Donnini
persons.context: Attorney copied on email correspondence regarding the subpoena to Interlochen Center for the Arts.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena seeks records of any tuition payments made by Epstein or his entities to Interlochen Center for the Arts.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Epstein in the subpoena seeking information from Interlochen Center for the Arts.

connections.description: Attorney-client communication regarding subpoena compliance between Interlochen's counsel and the U.S. Attorney's Office.
Both named as subjects in the subpoena seeking information from Interlochen Center for the Arts.
Both attorneys involved in responding to the subpoena regarding Interlochen Center for the Arts.

events.title: Subpoena issued to Interlochen
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene sends a subpoena to Interlochen Center for the Arts seeking information regarding Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Response to subpoena inquiry
events.description: Attorney Jeff Jocks responds that Interlochen only keeps tuition payment information for 7 years and found no records of payments by Epstein or his entities.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
310 West Front Street, Suite 300, Traverse City, Michigan
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office subpoenaed Interlochen Center for the Arts for records of tuition payments by Jeffrey Epstein or his entities.
Interlochen's attorney stated the institution only keeps tuition payment information for 7 years.
Interlochen found no records in their files reflecting any payments by Epstein or Epstein entities.
The subpoena also sought information regarding Ghislaine Maxwell.
The correspondence shows ongoing investigation into Epstein's financial activities, including potential payments to educational institutions.
